thing-type.label: FT098 9W Color Light Bulb
thing-type.description: 9W Color Light Bulb<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtOomi Bulb is a Z-Wave LED module which allows control (on/off/dim) with the use of Z-Wave. It's a bulb which has a Smart RGB LED, which can be used to add colour to your home. The bulb has 5 main colour channels available for you to adjust: Red, Green, Blue, Warm White and Cold White. You can configure its colour according to your favour. The Bulb is also a security Z-wave device and supports the Over The Air (OTA) feature for the product's firmware upgrade. </p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtToggle off the wall switch before you screw in Bulb and firmly screw in Bulb.</li&gt <li&gtSet your Z-Wave hub into pairing mode.</li&gt <li&gtToggle off the wall switch controlling your Bulb to turn it off (keep it in the "OFF" state for 2 seconds) and then toggle on the wall switch to turn your Bulb on, the green will blink to indicate the Bulb is entering into pairing mode.</li&gt <li&gtIf Bulb has been successfully added to your Z-Wave network, its RGB LED will be solid when you turn Bulb on.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtNote:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtIf your Bulb has already been added into another Z-Wave network, you'll need to remove it from the existing network first. Refer to the Exclusion instructions.</li&gt <li&gtTo check if LED Bulb is already paired to an existing network, toggle the wall switch off and on 3 times fast (the final ending position of the wall switch must be on). If LED Bulb blinks orange for 3 seconds, it is already paired into a Z-Wave network.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtYour Bulb can be removed from your Z-Wave network at any time. You'll need to use your Z-Wave network's main controller. To set your Z-Wave hub into removal mode, please refer to the respective section within your hubs instruction manual.</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet your Z-Wave hub into device removal mode.</li&gt <li&gtToggle the wall switch off and on 3 times fast (the final ending position of the wall switch must be on). If successful, the Bulb will change to orange colour for 2 seconds before changing to white. If removal was unsuccessful, then Bulb will blink orange for 3 seconds before changing to red colour for 2 seconds.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo check if LED Bulb is already paired to an existing network, toggle the wall switch off and on 3 times fast (the final ending position of the wall switch must be on). If LED Bulb blinks orange for 3 seconds, it is already paired into a Z-Wave network.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Power-on state
parameter.description: The bulb's state after power is applied

parameter.name: config_32_1
parameter.label: 32: Send report when color is changed

parameter.name: config_33_4
parameter.label: 33: Get the bulb's color value
parameter.description: Byte 1: reserved, Bytes 2, 3, 4: Red, Green, Blue<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValue 1 = Reserved</p&gt <p&gtValue 2 = Red color value</p&gt <p&gtValue 3 = Green color value</p&gt <p&gtValue 4 = Blue color value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_34_1
parameter.label: 34: Allow external switch to turn the bulb on/off

parameter.name: config_35_1
parameter.label: 35: Allow external switch to change the color

options.option: Save current colorful mode value and then exit

parameter.name: config_37_4
parameter.label: 37: Colorful mode configuration
parameter.description: Configure the colour cycling modes. See overview for details.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<h1&gtColour Display Cycle Configuration</h1&gt <p&gtParameter 37 [4 bytes] will cycle the colour displayed by the LED bulb into different modes:</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtColour Transition Style</td&gt <td&gtColour Change Speed Option</td&gt <td&gtColour Display Cycle</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtBrightness</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtCycle Count</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtTime Base of Colour Change Speed</td&gt <td&gtColour Change Speed Level</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<h1&gtColour Display Cycle (4 bits)</h1&gt <p&gtThe Colour Display Cycle field can have the following values, corresponding to 4 different modes:</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtInactive (keep the current configuration values)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtRainbow mode (red, orange, yellow, green, cyan, blue, violet)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtMulti Colour Mode (cycle between selected colours)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtRandom mode</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtSingle colour mode</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtReserved</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<h1&gtColour Transition Style (2 bits)</h1&gt <p&gtThe following values correspond to 2 different transition styles between colours:</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtSmooth Colour Transition</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtFade Out Fade In Transition</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<h1&gtCycle Count (8 bits)</h1&gt <p&gtThe Cycle Count is used to define the number of repetitions / cycles displayed by the LED bulb in Colour Display Cycle before stopping.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtUnlimited</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtTotal number of repetitions / cycles before stopping</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtInactive (keep the current configuration values)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<h1&gtBrightness (8 bits)</h1&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 = Min level. 99 = Max level.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtInactive (keep the current configuration values)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<h1&gtTime Base of Colour Change Speed (3 bits)</h1&gt <p&gtThis function would be used when the Colour Transition Style is set to Fade Out/In.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 = Min level. 99 = Max level.</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtInactive (keep the current configuration values)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<h1&gtColour Change Speed Level (5 bits)</h1&gt <p&gtThis function would be used when the Colour Transition Style is set to Fade Out/In.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtConstant speed</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtAccelerate / decelerate speed from the level 1 to 30</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtInactive (keep the current configuration values)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_38_4
parameter.label: 38: Change speed
parameter.description: Change the speed when going from OFF to ON, ON to OFF. See overview for details.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtChange speed:</p&gt <p&gtValue 1: the speed from OFF to ON</p&gt <p&gtValue 2: the speed from ON to OFF</p&gt <p&gtValue 3: pause time of ON</p&gt <p&gtValue 4: pause time of OFF</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_39_4
parameter.label: 39: Multi-colour configuration
parameter.description: Set up to 8 colours to cycle between when the LED is in Multi Colour Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<h1&gtColour Configuration</h1&gt <p&gtParameter 39 [4 bytes] can be used to set up to 8 colours to cycle between when LED bulb is in Multi Colour Mode. Colours transition from Colour Index 1-8.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtIndex 1</td&gt <td&gtIndex 2</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtIndex 3</td&gt <td&gtIndex 4</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtIndex 5</td&gt <td&gtIndex 6</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtIndex 7</td&gt <td&gtIndex 8</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<h1&gtColour Component Id</h1&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtRed</td&gt <td&gtOrange</td&gt <td&gtYellow</td&gt <td&gtGreen</td&gt <td&gtCyan</td&gt <td&gtBlue</td&gt <td&gtViolet</td&gt <td&gtPinkish</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<h2&gtExample</h2&gt <p&gtIf you set the parameter 39 to 305135616 (0x12300000), the colour will be changed from Red to Orange and then Orange to Yellow circularly (Red-Orange-Yellow)</p&gt <p&gtWhen the bulb is in Single Colour Mode and the Fade Out Fade In transition style, the parameter 39 would be used to set the RGB value:</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtRed value</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtGreen value</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtBlue value</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gtReserved</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt<p&gtWhen the bulb is in Random Mode, the parameter 39 would be used to set the random seed, then the bulb will automatically generate random colours to be displayed according to the random seed you set.</p&gt <table&gt<tr&gt<td&gtRandom seed value</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_255_4
parameter.label: 255: Reset to factory defaults
parameter.description: Reset the bulb, optionally also removing it from the z-wave network<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValue=0x55555555, Default=1, Size=4</p&gt <p&gtReset to factory default setting and removed from the z-wave network</p&gt <p&gtValue=0, Default=1, Size=1 Reset to factory default setting</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Group 1
parameter.description: Lifeline<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtWhen the state of Smart Switch (turn on/off the load) is changed:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet Configuration parameter 80 to 0:Reserved (Default).</li&gt <li&gtSet Configuration parameter 80 to 1:Send Hail CC.</li&gt <li&gtSet Configuration parameter 80 to 2:Send the Basic Report.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Group 2
parameter.description: Retransmit<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtForward the Basic Set, Switch Binary Set, Switch Multilevel Start Level Change, Switch Multilevel Stop Level Change, Switch Multilevel Set, Scene Activation Set to associated nodes in Group 2 when the Bulb receives the Basic Set, Switch Binary Set, Switch Multilevel Start Level Change, Switch Multilevel Stop Level Change, Switch Multilevel Set, Scene Activation Set commands from main controller.</p&gt
